resources.string: Would you like to enable the tutorial? This setting can be changed in the Settings.
InfoBars show extra data for each entry and can be changed using the dropdown menus.
The small, green arrows move between traits.
The current trait being collected. A list of active traits is displayed when the current trait is pressed.
The large, black arrows move between entries.
This is where the primary and secondary order are displayed.
Data is entered in the bottom area of the screen. Different trait types have different layouts.
The NA button is used to mark values as missing.
Data is deleted using this button.
The search icon allows database queries.
This displays a list of files in the Resources folder.
This displays a summary of all data for the current entry.
allows you to import and manage fields.
To start using Field Book, first import a field file.
allows you to add, import, and manage traits.
allows you to collect phenotypic data.
allows additional configuration for data collection.
Data can be exported in two formats: database or table.
Files must contain three columns: a unique identifier, a primary order, and a secondary order. The primary/secondary order are used for navigation in the field.
A field is selected for data collection after being imported.
To delete a field, open the menu on the left side of a field name and select Delete.
Add Trait creates a new trait. Different trait formats have different collection layouts.
Different trait formats are indicated with different icons.
Traits can be disabled from collection by toggling the checkbox.
